title: MicroservicesServiceCollaborationCommandSideReplica - Q0001
text: What is the primary purpose of a command-side replica in microservices?

options.text: To maintain a local copy of data needed for command processing

explanation: A command-side replica maintains a local copy of data required for command execution, reducing cross-service dependencies.

title: MicroservicesServiceCollaborationCommandSideReplica - Q0002
text: Which of the following best describes the command-side replica pattern?

options.text: A service keeps a replicated subset of another service’s data for command validation
A service replicates all data for reporting
A service shares a common database schema
A service uses synchronous API calls for all commands

explanation: The command-side replica pattern allows a service to maintain a subset of another service’s data for command validation and execution.

title: MicroservicesServiceCollaborationCommandSideReplica - Q0003
text: What problem does the command-side replica pattern solve?

options.text: Reduces synchronous dependencies between services during command execution

explanation: The command-side replica pattern reduces synchronous dependencies by allowing local command validation.

title: MicroservicesServiceCollaborationCommandSideReplica - Q0004
text: Which of the following is a key benefit of using a command-side replica?

options.text: Improved availability and reduced latency for command processing

explanation: Command-side replicas improve availability and reduce latency by avoiding remote service calls during command execution.

title: MicroservicesServiceCollaborationCommandSideReplica - Q0005
text: Which of the following is a common mechanism for keeping command-side replicas updated?
explanation: Command-side replicas are typically updated asynchronously through domain events published by the source service.

title: MicroservicesServiceCollaborationCommandSideReplica - Q0006
text: Which of the following is a key challenge in maintaining command-side replicas?

options.text: Ensuring eventual consistency between replicas and source data

explanation: Maintaining eventual consistency between replicas and source data is a key challenge in this pattern.

title: MicroservicesServiceCollaborationCommandSideReplica - Q0007
text: Which of the following is a benefit of command-side replicas for reliability?

options.text: Commands can still execute even if the source service is temporarily unavailable

explanation: Command-side replicas allow commands to execute locally even when the source service is unavailable.

title: MicroservicesServiceCollaborationCommandSideReplica - Q0008
text: Which of the following is a common data synchronization strategy for command-side replicas?

explanation: Event sourcing or CDC is commonly used to synchronize command-side replicas asynchronously.

title: MicroservicesServiceCollaborationCommandSideReplica - Q0009
